text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Lynx is an 8-bit personal computer released by Camputers in early 1983. The base machine has a Z80 processor clocked at 4 Mhz with 48 KB of RAM, but the 192 KB RAM version had a 6 Mhz. The Motorola video processor displays a resolution of 256x252 pixels in 8 colors and the sound is provided by a simple 6-bit DAC. With sloppy documentation, very slow sprite animation and partially accessible memory, few games will be released on this medium and it will be a commercial failure.
